overview: Students enrolled in the Master of Genetic Counselling (C04374) can apply to transfer into this exit-only course after completing 48 credit points of specified study and gain a graduate diploma qualification.
professional_recognition: Students who exit the Master of Genetic Counselling (C04374) with a Graduate Diploma in Genetic Counselling are not eligible to be listed on the HGSA register of genetic counsellors or to undertake certification as a genetic counsellor.

learning_outcomes.text: Demonstrate professional and ethical behaviour in supporting the provision of evidence based genetic and genomic health care.
Critically reflect on professional self-awareness and self-reflection in genetic counselling practice.
Engage effectively with diverse communities, acknowledging cultural and societal diversity and disparity in healthcare.
Utilise research skills to enhance professional practice in genetic counselling.
Provide education about genetics and genomics to a variety of audiences.

notes: This is an exit-only course. There is no direct admission to it. Current UTS students may be able to submit an Internal Course Transfer (Graduating) application to exit with this course. See the Course transfer page for further details.
admission_requirements: None; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
course_structure: This course comprises a total of 48 credit points.
